column4: Ugh. Why can't I copy a file to an (external HD) partition with "Read-only file system" error when mount saw "RW"?
probably a user issue, who mounted the drives
I used the gnome disk mount applet which required gksudo. So root I guess.
But my permissions on the mount point were listed as drwxrwxr-x
and are u copying using cp or visual
cp. Also tried sudo cp
and what are the filesystems?
hfsplus is the destination. reiserfs on source
that could be the problem, idk if it can convert them. are u copying a directory ot just a file;.?
Just a file. idk?
like a text file vs a folder
Just a file
ok try running cp -v
Ah, sudo cp works now?
well itll tell u whats going on, so ull get more detailed messages
cp -v  didn't tell me anything useful
but sudo cp worked
so it copied now?
Well, one file anyway.
hm, dunno what to tell you, is it failingfor other files?
I'm trying my big file now.
np
